adverb.description: Before or by now or the time in question.
examples: Anna has suffered a great deal already

adverb.description: Used as an intensive after a word or phrase to express impatience.
examples: enough already with these crazy kids and their wacky dances!

origin: Middle English: from all (as an adverb) + ready; already (sense 2) is influenced by Yiddish use.
